Help protect LGBTQ and reproductive health.
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Oliver Knight already had an IV in his arm when St. Joseph Hospital in Eureka canceled his surgery because he is transgender.

Now the St. Joseph Health system wants approval from the state of California to merge with another health care entity, Adventist Health. This could lead to even more patients being refused care because of religious doctrine, directly impacting hospitals across Northern California and holding implications for patients statewide.

Tell the Attorney General that California patients should not be denied health care based on religion.

Recently, UCSF rejected a partnership with Dignity Health, whose Catholic hospitals deny patients basic reproductive and LGBTQ-inclusive health care. Thousands of ACLU activists signed a petition opposing the partnership, which was critical to our victory!

Just like Dignity Health, St. Joseph discriminates against patients based on Catholic principles that call contraception evil and dismiss transgender people as suffering from a "mental disorder." Refusals by Catholic hospitals to provide much-needed care have resulted in the infection and even death of patients.

Adventist Health also denies abortion care and operates under values established by the Seventh-Day Adventist Church, which has similarly adopted policies that oppose reproductive health care and discriminate against LGBTQ people.

A merger would create an even more dominant system that could further block patients' access to care in Humboldt, Lake County, Sonoma, Solano, Mendocino, and Napa counties.

The Attorney General is seeking public comment and needs to hear from Californians like you. Sign our petition and make your voice heard.

Any approval should include the requirement that these institutions eliminate non-medical restrictions on reproductive health care, or at the very least maintain current levels and types of reproductive health services. In keeping with California non-discrimination law, transgender patients cannot be denied healthcare simply because they are transgender.

Thanks for taking action,

Phyllida Burlingame
Reproductive Justice & Gender Equity Director
ACLU of Northern California
